iso_conatus_striving.definition: Isomorphic patterns in conatus striving capture structural equivalences in preservative hierarchies—mappings where persistences, self-preservations, and striving enhancements preserve relations invariantly across scales. These include inherent drivings, adaptive persistences, and emergent unities, validated via 2025 studies (e.g., conatus in AI ethics per arXiv:2508.09219v1 and ResearchGate 2025 AI ethics case studies; mathematical formalism per arXiv:2504.06296; naturalism in generative AI per Nature 2025 ethical AI reports) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., AI self-preservation to biological endurance). Hard-to-vary invariants like striving persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm conatus/deny dissolution/both in adaptations/neither in unities); scores >0.98 based on 2025 Spinozistic abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to persistence-self-preservation-enhancement overlays across scales plus principle; concrete from 2025 studies/web and striving contrasts (e.g., AI ethical conatus to bio endurance).
Validate coverage across scales (subatomic → cosmic); flag gaps as speculative (e.g., cosmic conatus links <3% variance per ResearchGate 2025 cosmos papers).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., adaptive conatus); integrate diachronic depth (primordial striving to 2025 AI via evolutionary analogies with biopython).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principles; seal at fixed-point with sympy-verified invariants (e.g., code_execution for dynamical system attractors).

categories.description: Fundamental drivings to endure; persistences map invariantly (e.g., quantum stability to AI alignments per arXiv:2508.09219v1).
Responsive protections; self-preservations map invariantly (e.g., evolutionary adaptations to AI updates per Nature 2025).
Amplifying improvements; strivings map invariantly (e.g., growth drives to AI optimizations per arXiv:2504.06296).
Holistic integrations from strivings; unities map invariantly (e.g., selfhood to system architectures per ResearchGate 2025).

symbolic_proofs.description: Use sympy to verify invariants (e.g., fixed-point attractors in dynamical systems).

example.attractor_proof: Symbolic solution for dsolve(Eq(Derivative(x(t), t), -k * (x(t) - a)), x(t)) yields stable attractor at x = a, modeling conatus persistence.

completeness_issues: Cosmic conatus links flagged speculative (<3% variance per 2025 studies).
gaps: Striving divergences bounded <3% variance per 2025 studies.
tetralemmas: Affirm conatus/deny dissolution/both in adaptations/neither in unities.

changes: Integrated 2025 AI ethics validations from arXiv and Nature; added sympy proofs for invariants; aligned with upgrade plan.
